tp:treatment-sec.p: Pharciceratidae with open umbilicus in all growth stages; umbilical width ratio decreasing in the adult stage. Suture line with four to six umbilical lobes.

Bogoslovsky (1955) introduced the genus
Sphaeropharciceras
; the species
S. sandbergerorum
, which was newly named by him at the same time, was determined as the type species. This species was based on an illustration by Sandberger & Sandberger (1850 –1856: pl. 9 fig. 2), in which a small ( 13 mm conch diameter), almost globular specimen is shown.

The specimen was then figured and briefly discussed by House (in House & Ziegler 1977 : pl. 5 figs 24–26). House concluded that the distorted specimen has to be included in
Pharciceras tridens
. Unfortunately, this specimen is now considered lost; therefore, it cannot be verified whether it is indeed to be considered a synonym of
P. tridens
. Owing to the small size, however, it should hardly be possible to formulate a satisfactory species diagnosis.
